channel.title: BIOS Confessions
channel.description: Clear, structured explanations of core CS topics, from fundamentals to advanced principles. Learn for free, at your own pace.

item.title: Memory in Computer Architecture: Registers, Cache, RAM & Storage Explained
item.description: Detailed guide to how computer memory works, from registers and CPU caches to RAM, storage, memory addressing, paging, and the full memory hierarchy. Learn how modern systems manage data at every level.

item.title: The Art of Losing Slowly: How to Manage Risk, Variance and Decisions Under Uncertainty
item.description: Learn how to manage risk, leverage variance, and make better decisions under uncertainty. A practical guide to thoughtful losses, expected value, and long-term thinking.

item.title: How the Control Unit Makes the CPU Work: Signals, Microcode, and Decoding
item.description: Understand how the CPU Control Unit fetches, decodes, and executes instructions. Learn the differences between hardwired and microprogrammed control with clear examples.

item.title: Finding P Values and False Hope — Intro to Quantitative Finance
item.description: Discover how mathematics, statistics, and Python come together to explain and predict financial market behavior. In this introduction to quantitative finance, explore core concepts like interest rates, compounding, risk management, and bond pricing through practical, code-driven examples.

item.title: Understanding the ALU: Arithmetic, Logic, and Control Signals Explained
item.description: Discover how the ALU enables a CPU to perform arithmetic and logic operations using adders, subtractors, logic gates, and control signals.

item.title: Design Patterns for Performance: What Actually Works in High-Performance Systems
item.description: Learn how to use proven design patterns to build high-performance and low-latency systems. Explore the Reactor pattern, Actor model, Fan-out/Fan-in, Cache-Aside, Sharding, and resilience patterns like Circuit Breaker, Bulkhead, and Load Shedding. Improve speed, scalability, and maintainability in complex architectures.

item.title: Hello World in x86 Assembly: Step-by-Step Guide
item.description: Learn how to write and run a classic “Hello, World!” program in pure x86 assembly, step by step, using Docker for a clean and portable setup.

item.title: Refactoring a Bad Design: A Step-by-Step Example
item.description: Learn how to refactor an overgrown Java class using incremental steps, abstractions, and unit testing.

item.title: Understanding Logic Gates: AND, OR, XOR, NAND, Adders, and Flip-Flops
item.description: Learn digital logic circuits: AND, OR, NOT, XOR gates, combinational circuits, half-adder, full-adder, 8-bit adder, and sequential logic with flip-flops.

item.title: Introduction: Computer Architecture
item.description: Introduction for From Transistor to System: A Friendly Guide to Computer Architecture

item.title: Transistors: The Tiny Switch That Powers Modern Computers
item.description: A beginner-friendly introduction to how transistors work, from electricity fundamentals to semiconductor doping, MOSFET operation, and the invention that shaped modern computers.

item.title: The Harsh Truth About Your Design Pattern Choices
item.description: Most developers misuse design patterns. Learn when to apply them, when to avoid them, and how to simplify your architecture for real-world projects.
